chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on November 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:51 AM Defendant Miguel Custodio Jr. appeared by video, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Miguel Custodio Jr.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond is denied.  Address on file is correct. 715-896-7658 txt reminders okayed.
Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for PTC 11/2 and STC 11/14 @ 9AM.

8:46 AM Defendant Miguel Custodio Jr. appeared by video, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Miguel Custodio Jr.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant agreed to appear remotely. Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.

Bond Modification hearing on 10/31/2022 at 8:45 a.m. added per request of SPD Carly Sebion. CLO

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjourned initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Deputy Whaley or his family. Defendant only allowed contact with deputy in his official compacity.

1:03 PM Defendant Miguel Custodio Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Sebion appeared specially. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Update address W9017 Beartrap Lane.  AIA and bond hearing set for 10/21 at 1:00 pm.
